reviewText:
Without a doubt the worst fighting game i have ever played.
Pros:
- It's free.
- It installed and uninstalled pretty quickly.

Cons:
- The A.I button mashes like a 3 year old.
- The controls are super sensitive yet also unresponsive (How the hell does that even happen?)
- The characters don't exactly look like they're fighting, they just kind of awkwardly clip through eachother and then bounce around the screen.
- There's a character named Bones" who the developers claim is an "Original character"....so these guys created skeletons? Ok then.
- Also
date:
there isn't a character in the movie Night of the living dead named "Living dead" and the zombies in the movie don't even look like that.
- The game is in Beta but it doesn't mention that anywhere on the store page. If this is the Beta then i'd hate to see what kind of wretched mess the Alpha build was.

Oh God.
If you're the developer and you're reading this then you have some massive balls for putting this on Steam because it is horrible and ♥♥♥♥ but at least it's free.
Still ♥♥♥♥ though."

reviewText:
Although Clash of the Monsters is, to put it in the kindest words I can find, absolutely pitiful and cursed by each and every god from every religion or creed that has ever existed, I want to help. I can't fix your hideous collision detection, I can't change the identical movesets for every single one of your characters, I can't help you make this resemble even the most sketchily playable example of a fighting game... but, by god, I can help you with your roster.

'Bones'? Really? The Invisible Man? Ichabod Crane and the Headless Horseman? The Horseman didn't exist even in the story, ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ you. That was the entire point of- okay, I'm not getting drawn into this. I'm here to help. Now, obviously, your roster is limited by what is in the public domain and is therefore free from copyright limitations, yes? Well, I have amassed my own fearsome stable of iconic monsters that I think you will find to be quite the improvement. Feast your eyes.

THE RAVEN from Edgar Allan Poe's... The Raven. Can be the size of a man if you like. The poem didn't specifically state that it wasn't.
ANY OF THE FREAKS from Tod Browning's Freaks (1932). Special move could involve surrounding the opponent chanting 'One of us, one of us' while the armless girl kicks them in the yam bag.
THE GHOST TRAIN from The Ghost Train (1941). Throws passengers at you for its projectile attack.
SNOWBEAST from Snowbeast (1977). This one's a no-brainer. Plus it was made as recently as '77. One to help you get your game 'down' with the 'kids', Whatever they are.
THE NOW-VISIBLE MAN, a Clash of the Monsters original! Just like the Invisible Man except now you can see him too, giving you exactly the same advantage as your AI opponent seems to have!

Seriously though: love the concept but good god, the work this would need to even function reliably. I went a couple of rounds with it below.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fv_Ss8♥♥♥hI

reviewText:
OverviewClash of the Monsters intrigued me when I first saw it because of its concept; classic movie monsters battling it out, so it was promptly added to my wishlist.

Here we are, the game is out, and just over an hour into it, I cannot recommend it. At all.

The developer says the game is in beta, but from attempting to play it, it feels more like a very unpolished early access title. In fact, if this were released in early access, I’d be more forgiving toward it. But alas.

The game has controller support, but I don’t know why; controller usage is horrendous. Even a slight move of the stick causes the cursor to move rapidly. Tilting it to the right to select a character sends the selection flying. This occurs with both my Xbox One wireless, and Steam controllers.

Character selection is okay, but slightly odd. I question why Ichabod Crane is a character, when he wasn’t a monster. Or why there’s a monster called “living dead”, ie: zombie. There’s no creature in horror movie history called “living dead”. Developer’s claim of it being from Night of the Living Dead is dubious, at best. As for levels, there’s only one, and it’s very generic.

Hovering the mouse over a character doesn’t do anything, but clicking instantly chooses that character for you. Why? Why can’t I click once to see the character, and again to confirm? Once you’ve gotten to the screen to select the level, you can’t go back; if you want to change characters, you’ll need to start the match, exit, and redo everything. Not sure why a “back” button is so difficult, but I digress.

Graphically, the game is quite ugly. The models are very basic, the only available level (as of this review) is basic. Sound effects and music may as well be absent; I’d prefer silence over the bad effects in this.

Controls while fighting are questionable. Escape does nothing, but spacebar is the pause button. When I tried to quit a match by going to “back to menu”, it looked like a box popped up asking if I was sure, but immediately disappeared, leaving me to let the timer run out. There’s also no mouse cursor in the pause menu, so you have to use the keyboard, which wouldn’t be a bad thing if the menu actually responded to what you wanted. The only way to actually get the three options to work is to use the mouse to click them, as the keyboard controls just pop up and then disappear. But since the mouse doesn’t actually have a cursor and you have to guess where it’s hovering, this is ridiculous. And once you do click “Yes” to exiting to the main menu, you have to press space to close the pause screen before it loads the main menu. This is not the 90s, things like this should not happen.

As for multiplayer, you’re basically back in the early nineties where you need the IP address of the person in order to connect. Yeah. I had no problem doing that when I played Doom back in 1993, but it’s 2016.

Lastly, it’s free to play. Not necessarily a bad thing, but there are no advertisements and nothing to purchase so far, so I question where the revenue comes from. Perhaps the developer will release additional character packs over time. Hopefully those packs will come after the game has been put into a playable state.

ProsFree?
Has potential to be an interesting fighterConsGraphics are horrendous
Some odd character options
Very limited playability
Poor control scheme, both with keyboard and controller
Poor UI that doesn’t respond to mouse interactions correctly unless you’re at the main menu
Multiplayer requires direct connection to IP; info says matchmaking will come eventually, but that should be a pretty basic option for a game that advertises multiplayer
Special moves are pretty basic and don’t also register, despite the same combos being usedSummaryIt may be free to play, but it’s best to avoid this until (if) it gets some major fixes. Controls are horrible, graphics are horrible, gameplay is horrible, and it’s just, overall, a pretty terrible game at the moment, and I really don’t know this is not in early access. The current state is definitely more alpha than beta.

I wish the developer the best of luck, and will gladly change this review and even purchase items if the core of the game gets fixed. Until then, find your fighting need elsewhere.

reviewText:
If your looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place, but if your looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.

Ingredients:
1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter
2. 1/2 cup white sugar
3. 1/2 cup brown sugar
4. 1/4 cup water
5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon
6. 1 pinch salt
7. 5 apples - peeled, cored and sliced
8. 1 pastry for double-crust pie

Directions:
1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
2. Combine butter, white sugar, brown sugar, water, cinnamon, and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, remove from heat and set aside.
3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate; pour in apple slices.
4. Roll out top crust into a 10-inch circle. Cut into 8 (1-inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips, one at a time, into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.
5. Pour butter-sugar mixture over top of pie, coating the lattice, and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.
6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and bake until the crust is golden brown, the caramel on the top crust is set, and the apple filling is bubbling, 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.

Eat.

reviewText:
I applied for a Steam Refund on a free game.....

This is the worst game i've ever played.  The fact the released it in this stage.....for free......why?  Such a cool idea.....Such Garbage.

I cannot control the main menu with a xbox controller.  I feel like i did a bunch of coke and when i push down just a hair, i fly through the entire menu option 5 or 6 times.  So after spinning the wheel a few times, i finally got to Arcade Mode which allowed me to enter the fighter select screen.  At this screen i was limited to one or two fighters, as the sensitivity is through the roof, it is impossible to select the fighter you want.  So, take a drink and spin the wheel again to see which fighter you will get.

Upon finally picking whoever the game wanted me to play as a fighter, I entered my first match.  The fight started, my character started jumping up and down over and over again.  i checked my controller, it was centered and nothing was pushing it.  After a minute of watching my guy doing trampolene warm ups i touched the controller.  i pushed the right button to move my character to fight and he started punching.

I decided at this point to quit and reinstall the game.  I pushed the start button.  Nothing happened.  I pushed the escape key on the keyboard.  Nothing happened.  That i know of, there is no way to pause or quit this game without ALT-F4.

This is truly the worst free game i've ever played.

reviewText:
Product received for free

Very recently my great grandmother, as well as my dog passed away. It's been very difficulty dealing with school and I often didn't want to interact socially. I downloaded this game one day from Steam and it's really changed the way I act and feel. It's strange, the game is nothing special in any profound sort of way, but I just really really enjoy it. The games combat is simple enough but very rewarding, and playing with your friends is bound to make tons of laughs for hours on end.

I don't like giving out specific numbers, but I would recommend this game to anyone.

reviewText:
Look, I know this game isn't perfect. It needs a lot of polishing. And I am super hammered right now. But I think this game deserved a fighting chance, like ut of Oblivion, you know? I really don't know what to say. This Game would be perfect if it had $100,000,000 budget.

But in all seriousnes I am drunk and I do love the idea. The AI is a bit too hard and the controld need work. I don't see why this can't be a 70/100 on metacritic with some work. I't a fun game to pass the time and wish you weren't out of vodka.

But in all seriousness it is a valient attempt at a game. I want to see this developer do more. This Concept is great and could be perfect for Halloween parties. Though, I am drunk and am not into fighting games.

But in all seriousness 3/10 would await future updates.

than games i see from AAA companies that spend only a year on a game! I'd say you

reviewText:
-Gnome Lord's Review 4/15/2016-
Let's be clear up front. In it's current state, this game is rough. VERY rough. So why have I given it a positive review? Because I have some faith in this could be gem, and considering it is free, I am willing to continue to give it more of my time so long as improvments progressivly debut. I'll give a short summary of the game, and my experience with it so far.

Clash of Monsters is a classic 2D plane fighting game featuring in horror themed characters from both popular film and literature works.  As of current, the game has 8 characters, with only 7 seemingly playable These include in no specific order, The Living Dead (Classic Zombie), Nosferatru (The O.G Vampire), The Headless Horseman (Pumpkin Lord). Ichabod Crane (Sleepy Hollow Protagonist), The Bride of Dracula (Traditional Vampire), The Invisible Man (Basically a Phantom), and Bones (A Skeleton). The 8th character is supposably The Phantom of the Opera" but I am unable to pick him myself for whatever reason.

Each character currently has two punches
recommended: and a throw. There is currently no block button
hoursPlayed: and this is something I think is certainly needed as it is otherwise too easy to get pummeled (tho maybe I just need more practice.)  When testing around with each character
voteText: it is apparent they each have unique abilities such as The Bride of Dracula sprouting wings and leaping across the stage
helpfulPercent: or the Living Dead latching onto an opponent to munch on their torso
votesHelpful: which is great and adds unique flavors to each character. Speaking of stages
commentsCount: and it is pretty basic featuring a stone walkway
column17: and twisted trees and water in the background. Nothing too exciting
column18: yet.\n\nWhile the game has controller support
column19: it definetly needs some work. Navigating the menu can be a struggle with the cursor flying all over the place
column20: and fights in general are very clunky. It feels like some of my moves are delayed
column21: and that is a big no no in fighting games. The game has a special moves list for each character
column22: but this can only be accessed in battle and frankly was sometimes tough to open. I have not attempted to use the keyboard often because I don't find them suitable for my fighting game needs.\n\nThe graphics are maybe comparable to that of the early Ps3/Xbox360 era. They could no doubt use some work
column23: but the inspiration is clearly there
column24: it just needs to be put into further motion with more detail being desired by myself. The games audio is average. It needs more music as there is currently only one mind numbing song which gets repetative quick due to its distinct "epic" theme. And the sound effects in general are for the most part seemingly shared among characters with a few small exceptions.\n\nIn it's current state
column25: I would have to give this game a 5 out of 10
column26: maybe a 6 if I was feeling generous. The inspiration is there
column27: but this game is far too rough in its current stage to be what I would consider a Beta. However
column28: in an era where couch co-op is rapidly fading
column29: and games like thisoffer more of those chances
column30: I am willing to put my hopes in the future of this game so long as the Dev's take note in what the public desires in order to mold and shape a quality fighting game worthy of anyone's steam library."

reviewText:
First of all, let me just say that I absolutely LOVE the idea of the game! Although in its momentary state, I couldn't recommend it, but I still give an upvote, because I've fallen in love with game idea, and I can't wait for other playable monsters, and other maps!
And I don't have any problems with the graphics or the animation, I quiet like it to be honest, it gives the game a creepy vibe, but hey, maybe it's just my opinion.

But I have experienced a pretty weird thing. Now I'm not sure if I only didn't get something right, or are these real issues.
When i select the character, I click on it with the mouse. But if I do that, player2 is also going to be the one that i chose for myself. I tried using the keyboard for choosing different character, but no matter which one i pressed, it didn't react to it, so I always had to fight against the same monster that I also chose. (although I play this with keyboard, so maybe it works fine with a controller)

And some other reviews already wrote: pausing problems, no quit button, weird deafult buttons, and bad/weird controls (or at least with keyboard).

So in conclusion: there are many things that are needed to be fixed. BUT with a little more work, it can become an amazing game, with great and unique content!

reviewText:
It's a BETA so it isn't really too fair to judge it but as it stands right now---

Pros:
- Neat concept
- Decent theme
- It's free
- Low enough requirements that it should run on even crappy systems

Cons:
- So far some of the animations aren't done or don't work well (IE: grabbing an opponent)
- God-awful default keyboard controls (but they are changeable, and 360 controller is supported)
- Slow response to input, which can get you easily killed quickly because--
- Opponents can react before the system even registers your input, they are much faster than you

If you like retro-style fighting games (this game reminds me of a few PS1 and PS2 titles that weren't well known but weren't bad) and want to give a free BETA game a try, and or have an affinity for horror / monsters as I do, give it a shot.

reviewText: This game is getting way too much hate than it deserves. I dont see any problems with it to be honest. I love it, people are complaining about the low charcater count, have none of you ever played a fighting game that wasnt made in the past ten years??? 8 characters is plenty. And yes there is only one map but this game is still in very early development. Dont complain about controls, use a controller. dont use a keyboard with a pc fighting game. This game is amazing and has so much more potential. I am going to continue playing it and I cannot wait to see what is next in what I am imagining being a great and amazing game.

reviewText: Put about 2 hours in this game so far, and I really like it. Breaking down a new fighting game to a science is fun to me. Ive found infinites, great mixups and combos with certain characters. I personally like Bones, his ability to zone and keep the pressure is what I love. I will be posting a combo video and tutorial for Bones this evening or tomarrow. Anyone who wants to see that can message me via steam. Willing to do matches and Will live stream to help support this game.\n\nI reccomend this game to anyone who likes Fighting games, The best way to decribe it is Mortal Kombats game speed, Killer instinct combo potential, Street fighter mixups. If you are having trouble with a Controller use a Fightsick, had no issue plugging it in and playing.
